ygData.subject: SV: SV: Q: Odd situation...?
ygData.msgSnippet: Now that you mention it.... Me and a friend created each a human paladin in freeport, with the purpose of annoying everyone with silly names dueling.. We put
ygData.messageBody:
Now that you mention it....
Me and a friend created each a human paladin in freeport, with the purpose of annoying everyone with silly names dueling.. We put the bonus point the same and we didn't kill anything or gained any exp or levels.. Simple level 1 characters wearing nothing and wielding the newbie sword.. We dueled about 5 times and EVERY time I beat the crap out of him by far, I didn't even loose half my hitpoints in any of the duels.. It COULD however be just a fluke.. Btw the characters were the same gender..

- Avron -


----- Original Message -----
From: William Orent <will8155@...>
To: <EverQuest@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, November 05, 1999 8:02 AM
Subject: Re: SV: [EverQuest] Q: Odd situation...?


> From: William Orent <will8155@...>
>
> It could also be a possibility that there are certain stats randomly created when
> you make a character that we are unaware of. Verant has said that as a part of
> the game they don't want people to know exactly how combat and damage work, and
> there could be a slight difference in your to-hit and damage calculations from
> some unknown variables
>
> Randy & Lori Alliani wrote:
>
> > From: alliani@... (Randy & Lori Alliani)
> >
> > LOL! OH! For a minute there you had me scared! I in NO way
> > intended to imply favoritism (though one of my friends claims I was
> > just "smiled upon by the Gods" and my husband was not <G>). However,
> > as you mentioned, I wouldn't put it completely past them. I have even
> > heard rumor (strictly hearsay) that Verant at first had no intention
> > of having the armor "show" on female characters.... So the guys down
> > in the design and programming department may have a
> > few...preferences...they're entertaining. <bg>.
> >
> > But...Now that you mention it, I may have to create two new
> > male/female characters with identical stats just to see what
> > happens... :)
> >
> > Lliani
> >
> > On Thu, 4 Nov 1999 18:06:35 -0800, you wrote:
> >
> > >From: "Steve Graham" <sdgraham@...>
> > >
> > >i think the biggest point here is that as far as she can tell, the
> > >characters are matched except for gender. wouldn't it be one sick joke if
> > >Verant had been nerfing the genders differently all along so that the female
> > >is easier to play than her male equivalent? this would definitely
> > >demonstrate an evil intent by Verant to undermind the family unit and i
> > >would have to report them to the appropriate conservative left wing
> > >factions....just kidding.
> > >
> > >really wouldn't put it past them though...seriously
> >
> > > Visit the EverQuest homepage at http://www.everquest.com
>
> > Visit the EverQuest homepage at http://www.everquest.com
>
